availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Ravencraft (Maysville, Kentucky, boarding housekeeper, and coal inspector)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, boarding housekeeper and coal inspector. Lewis County, Kentucky, native. Married to Margaret Ellis Ravencraft in Mason County, Kentucky, on July 9, 1846. Father of Jane Ravencraft Arthur, Mary Ravencraft, Alice Ravencraft, and John Ravenscraft. Boarding housekeeper in Maysville in 1850. Coal inspector in Maysville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 36A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 312.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #669.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, Film #000281843.
